messages.title: Labour's pledges for a future fair for all
messages.content: Each pledge is substantial, deliverable and carefully costed, speaking to the values of Britain's mainstream majority.

messages.title: Why we're voting Labour
messages.content: In their most moving contribution, Gordon and Sarah Brown talk about their family, showing the human side of the political debate.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Halve the deficit through economic growth, fair taxes and cuts to lower priority spending.
Investing in policing, schools, childcare and the NHS, with a new guarantee of cancer test results within a week.
Through an Australian style points-based system to control immigration, guaranteed education, apprenticeships and jobs for young people, and a crackdown on anti-social behaviour.

Keeping mortgage rates as low as possible; increasing tax credits for families with young children; providing new help for first-time buyers; and restoring the link between the state pension and earnings from 2012.
Supporting businesses and industry to create one million more skilled jobs and modernising our infrastructure with High-Speed Rail, a Green Investment Bank and broadband access for all.

issues.economy: Halve the deficit through economic growth, fair taxes and cuts to lower priority spending.
issues.health: Investing in policing, schools, childcare and the NHS, with a new guarantee of cancer test results within a week.
issues.immigration: Australian style points-based system to control immigration.
issues.socialWelfare: Increasing tax credits for families with young children; providing new help for first-time buyers; and restoring the link between the state pension and earnings from 2012.

housing.content: Increasing tax credits for families with young children; providing new help for first-time buyers;

quotes.text: Labour wants to make it a little bit easier for ordinary people
